review: This is the best thing since slice bread, I'm still getting use to it. Yesterday I added a lot of free apps like yoga, Pilates, HBO Togo, but silly me I thought the HBO channel was free my daughter told me,  yes the app is free but you have to buy a subscription to HBO that right there should tell you I'm not a tech WIZ. Anyway it's easy to install (I used Quentin Moore's installation video as a guide, Moore is a top Amazon reviewer) and navigating between  menus is a no brainer once you get the hang of it. It was also great getting the complete set-up including batteries in one box meaning I did not have get up and go to the store for extra parts. If Amazon (my favorite place) is listening a free" how to get the most from your stick manual" should be included and the Amazon Fire Stick should be larger, but that would mean bigger boxes and more shipping costs for Amazon. In this imperfect world I'm satisfied with what I have. Ciao

review: I do like the convenience. I have an Apple tv in the other room, and I'd have to say the Fire Stick remote and function is not as intuitive as the Apple tv. I was also a bit disappointed to find out some programming is only available to Android users. I have an HBO Go subscription but it's only accessible for those using an Android phone. I have an iPhone. Oh well. The Fire Stick is a nice bit of technology and a fun toy to have. I still give it 4 stars. Good job.
